creator: sachink@boss-solutions.com
text:
Dear all,

I am trying to install Apache 1.3.12 from source on solaris 2.6
Configuration process complets successfully but while 'make', I get following 
error
message.

I've gone through similar problem reported earlier and tried the same but could 
not resolve the issue.

I did,

%./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache
make 

Error message

"ap_snprintf.c", line 1163: va_start: argument 
mismatch                            
ap_snprintf.c: In function 
`ap_snprintf':                                          
ap_snprintf.c:1163: `__builtin_va_alist' undeclared (first use in this 
function)   
ap_snprintf.c:1163: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only 
once              
ap_snprintf.c:1163: for each function it appears 
in.)                              
gmake[2]: *** [ap_snprintf.o] Error 
1                                              
gmake[1]: *** [subdirs] Error 
1                                                    
gmake: *** [build-std] Error 
2                                                     
make: Fatal error: Command failed for target 
`build'                               

Anybody's help is highly appreciated.

Sachin

Ant is not make. Make is not Ant. Ant is the build tool for the Apache java 
projects, including tomcat, but it has nothing to do with the main Apache web 
server. You need to file this against some other bugzilla listed product. Sorry.
creator: steve_l@iseran.com
